text: finally today two days after flight mh17
was shot out of the sky the passengers
and crew were being shown some respect
teams of emergency workers were combing
the fields and bringing the dead out on
stretchers but the main crash site is
still in the hands of the pro-russia
armed rebels the same men that are
suspected of shooting down the plane by
mistake in the surrounding villages some
residents were paying their respects
they understand the enormity of what
happened because as one woman told me it
was on their homes and streets that
parts of the plane and some of the
bodies rained down people found
passports of man and women from
Amsterdam children's toys rags arcs was
personal letters this is a quiet part of
rural Ukraine which now finds itself in
a war zone and at the center of an
international tragedy the people who
live in this village house told us that
they heard the explosion they came
outside to see what was going on and at
that moment this a large piece of a
Boeing 777 landed in front of them the
best theory is that the plane was hit by
one of these a buk m1 anti-aircraft
missile that had got into rebel hands
but the Ukrainian intelligence service
goes further to operate book and one you
need to have education military
education and to be well trained we know
for sure that those the team was Russian
there were Russian citizens operating
buk m1 and they came from the territory
of Russian Federation
together with the missile launcher in
this sunflower field we found the
cockpit of mh17 the place where most
likely the pilots briefly wrestled to
control their plane which had been hit
by an anti-aircraft missile the pilots
bodies were gone the site was guarded by
a lone gunman in the wreckage someone's
souvenirs of Holland's World Cup
campaign
five miles from the main crash site
completely unguarded we were still
finding large pieces of the aircraft the
on-the-ground investigation of who was
responsible for this atrocity has not
even begun
Daniel Sanford BBC News grab over
